intro: Cyrtandra paludosa var. alnifolia, commonly known as the swamp cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in wet or marshy habitats. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or pale blue. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinct, slightly heart-shaped base. This variant is distinguished by its leaf morphology and habitat preferences compared to other Cyrtandra species.
